# Day 951

**Running on Bitcoin: Your Ticket to Financial Freedom**

Living on a Bitcoin standard is better; it is a declaration of financial independence. It's like telling the traditional banking system, "I'm out," and moonwalking away from a rigged casino where the house keeps printing chips. With Bitcoin, you're not just playing the game; you're rewriting the rules. You're sidestepping inflation like it's a puddle on the sidewalk and securing a hard asset that laughs in the face of dilution.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*ABJslKT_Zttl5OemJmqzAg.png)

HODLing isn't just a typo - it's a lifestyle choice. It's the financial equivalent of planting your own garden because you're fed up with overpriced, tasteless tomatoes from the supermarket. When you own Bitcoin, you're holding something that central banks can't reach - not even with their longest levers. Inflation? That's a bedtime story to scare fiat users (as they should be). Every satoshi you hold is a vote for freedom and a hedge against governments who think money printers should go "brrr." They can't print more Bitcoin, and that's where the real magic happens.

Think about it: what's worth more - a rare Van Gogh or one of those "Live, Laugh, Love" posters your aunt has in her kitchen? Exactly. Bitcoin versus fiat currency is the same deal. One is genuinely scarce; the other is churned out faster than memes in a group chat. Bitcoin's 21 million cap isn't just a number; it's a digital decree that sets an unbreakable limit. While the dollar loses value year after year due to inflation, Bitcoin stands firm as your financial lifeboat, ready to navigate you through turbulent economic waters.

![](https://miro.medium.com/0*xHOL6mMiQ8aV0Hoc.png)

Now, money moves in four ways, and understanding them can change how you see the world. First, there's spending your own money on yourself - you make every penny count, hunting for the best deals. Then there's spending your money on others: sure, gifts are nice, but let's face it, that fancy gadget will be outdated by next Tuesday. Next up, spending other people's money on yourself. Ah, the joys of expense accounts - ordering the steak instead of the salad because someone else is footing the bill. Finally, spending other people's money on others. Ever wonder how governments manage to burn through trillions like it's spare change? Now you know. When it's not your money and it's not benefiting you directly, fiscal responsibility tends to take a back seat! Every time - without fail.

Choosing Bitcoin is like snagging a VIP pass to financial freedom - you skip the lines and avoid the usual hassles. No need for constant portfolio juggling like a circus performer on a tightrope. It's simple: get Bitcoin, secure it, and let it do its thing. No late-night number crunching, no chasing after the next big stock, no fear of missing out when your neighbor brags about his latest get-rich-quick scheme. With Bitcoin, your savings don't just sit; they stand guard like a fortress with high walls and a moat full of alligators. If you can stomach the volatility and think long term that is.

Dealing with fiat currency is like trying to fill a bucket with a hole in it - no matter how fast you pour, it never stays full. Inflation is the sneaky leak draining your hard-earned savings, pushing you into risky ventures just to stay afloat. But with Bitcoin, you're holding the financial equivalent of a diamond - hard, unbreakable, and not subject to the whims of some central banker having a bad day. No dilution, no bailouts, no funny business.

Looking to hedge against life's uncertainties? Just HODL Bitcoin. Whether it's next month or a decade from now, your satoshis will still be standing strong, untouched by the erosion of inflation. Don't trust me though. I am not a financial advisor and this is not financial advice. It's a recommendation to verify for yourself.

In my personal experience, life gets a whole lot simpler when you're rolling with Bitcoin. It really is basic math: finite assets beat infinite liabilities every time, at least as a store of value. When the financial system feels like it's designed to nickel and dime you into oblivion, Bitcoin is the escape hatch you've been searching for. So start small. Stack those sats like you're collecting rare coins. Then kick back and sleep like a baby - a baby that gets richer overnight without having to worry about managing a portfolio.

![Running B](https://miro.medium.com/1*4WiltQR3PRw7SADQwwbVIw.png)
